intro: Diodia serrulata, commonly known as narrow-leaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has finely serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinct appearance. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks. Diodia serrulata is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in humid environments.
